title: System Design
description: Master scalable system architecture and design patterns
introduction: System design focuses on building scalable, reliable, and maintainable distributed systems. Essential for senior engineer roles and technical interviews.

concepts.name: Load Balancer
concepts.example:
Algorithm Options:
- Round Robin: Sequential distribution
- Least Connections: Server with fewest active connections
- IP Hash: Based on client IP
- Weighted Round Robin: Based on server capacity

concepts.name: Caching Strategy
concepts.example:
Cache-Aside Pattern:
1. Check cache for data
2. If miss, query database
3. Store result in cache
4. Return data

TTL (Time To Live): Set expiration
Cache Invalidation: Remove stale data

examples.title: URL Shortener Design
examples.code:
Components:
1. API Server
   - POST /shorten - Create short URL
   - GET /:shortCode - Redirect to original

2. Database (NoSQL)
   - Store: shortCode -> originalURL
   - Index on shortCode

3. Cache (Redis)
   - Hot URLs for fast lookup

4. ID Generation
   - Base62 encoding
   - Counter or hash-based
